25:Tdfb,<entryFree id="n44826" key="يَوْمٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">يَوْمٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">A time, whether night or day;</hi> (Msb;) <hi rend="ital">time absolutely, whether night or not, little or not:</hi> this is the proper signification: (Kull, p. 390:) and <hi rend="ital">day,</hi> meaning the <hi rend="ital">period from the rising of the sun to its setting;</hi> (Lth, TA:) the <hi rend="ital">time when the sun is above the earth:</hi> this is the common conventional acceptation: (Kull, ubi suprà:) and the <hi rend="ital">period from the second</hi> [<hi rend="ital">or true</hi>] <hi rend="ital">dawn to sunset:</hi> (Msb, Kull:) this is the legal acceptation: (Kull:) and <hi rend="ital">a civil day:</hi> the <hi rend="ital">period of the revolution of the greatest firmament.</hi> (Kull)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also, <hi rend="ital">An accident,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">event;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">كَوْنٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">كَائِنَةٌ</foreign>. Ex., <foreign lang="ar">نِعْمَ ٱلْأَخُ فُلَانٌ فِى اليَوْمِ إِذَا نَزَلَ بِنَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Excellent is the brother, such a one, in the case of the accident, when it befalls us.</hi> (T.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  See <foreign lang="ar">نَهَارٌ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">يَأْتِينَا يَوْمَ يَوْمَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He comes to us day after day,</hi> i. e., <hi rend="ital">every day:</hi> (Sharh esh-Shudhoor:) and <foreign lang="ar">يَوْمَ يَوْمٍ</foreign>. (In a verse cited by IJ. in Mz, sect. on the <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَة</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">مَجَاز</foreign>.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">يَوْمٌ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">A dayjourney,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">day's journey.</hi>          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A day,</hi> as in our phrase “ he won the day; ” meaning <hi rend="ital">contest, fight,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">battle:</hi> I render it <hi rend="ital">a day</hi> [<hi rend="ital">of conflict</hi>].          <sense type="b" n="7">-b7-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أَيَّامُ العَرَبِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The</hi> [<hi rend="ital">days,</hi> (agreeably with an English, as well as Arabian, usage,) meaning] <hi rend="ital">conflicts</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">وَقَائِع</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">of the Arabs.</hi> (ISk, T.)          <sense type="b" n="8">-b8-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">اِبْنُ يَوْمِهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He who thinks</hi> [<hi rend="ital">only of the present day,</hi>] <hi rend="ital">not of the morrow.</hi> (Er-Rághib. in TA, art. <foreign lang="ar">بنى</foreign>.)          <sense type="b" n="9">-b9-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">يَوْمُ الشَّكِّ</foreign>: see <foreign lang="ar">شَكٌّ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="10">-b10-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">بَيْن الأَيَّامِ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">فِيمَا بَيْنَ الأَيَّامِ</foreign>: see <foreign lang="ar">نَدْرَةٌ</foreign>, in two places.
